newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold prices fall, volume leaps on demand.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold prices fall, volume leaps on demand.

text.p: Gold prices were lower on Istanbul's gold exchange on Monday in line with weaker levels in European markets, but volume jumped on fresh demand from the free market after the weekend, dealers said.

Gold closed at $381.85 an ounce and 1,116,000 lira per gram, down from Friday's $383.10 and 1,117,700 lira. The drop in lira terms was less because of a weaker Turkish lira which ended at 90,820 to the dollar, down from Friday's 90,420.
Traded volume soared to 1,690 kilos from 595 previously and compared with last Monday's 935 kilos.
Dealers said demand was strong after weekend gold jewellery and coin sales in the free market with the help of lower gold prices in world markets.

The bulk of the activity -- 1,456 kilos -- was done in the morning, followed by 234 kilos in the second session with 82.6 percent of the total turnover in lira terms. --Istanbul newsroom +90-212-2750875
